title: 103_hr2143
content:
The "Nuclear Regulatory Commission Authorization Act for Fiscal Years 1994 and 1995" may be cited as the Act. Authorization of appropriations for fiscal years 1994 and 1995 is granted. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission is authorized to receive appropriations for fiscal years 1994 and 1995, with specific amounts allocated for each year from the Nuclear Waste Fund. Additionally, funding is authorized for the Office of Inspector General. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission is authorized to receive appropriations from the Nuclear Waste Fund for fiscal years 1994 and 1995. The Office of Inspector General is also allocated specific funding amounts for fiscal years 1994 and 1995. The Office of Inspector General of the Nuclear Regulatory Commission is authorized to receive specific funding amounts for fiscal years 1994 and 1995, totaling $4,800,000 for 1994 and $5,000,000 for 1995. SEC. 3. ALLOCATION OF AMOUNTS AUTHORIZED. The amounts authorized under section 2(a) for fiscal years 1994 and 1995 are allocated as follows: 
- $163,807,000 for fiscal year 1994 and $168,005,000 for fiscal year 1995 for "Reactor Safety and Safeguards Regulation"
- $99,969,000 for fiscal year 1994 and $98,339,000 for fiscal year 1995 for "Reactor Safety Research"
- $61,880,000 for "Nuclear material and low-level waste safety and safeguards regulation" For fiscal years 1994 and 1995, funding allocations include:
- $61,880,000 for "Nuclear Material and Low-Level Waste Safety and Safeguards Regulation"
- $22,000,000 for "High-Level Nuclear Waste Regulation" from the Nuclear Waste Fund. For fiscal years 1994 and 1995, funding allocations include:
- $61,880,000 for "Nuclear Material and Low-Level Waste Safety and Safeguards Regulation"
- $22,000,000 for "High-Level Nuclear Waste Regulation" from the Nuclear Waste Fund. For fiscal years 1994 and 1995, funding allocations include:
- $22,000,000 for "High-Level Nuclear Waste Regulation" from the Nuclear Waste Fund.
- Not more than $31,000,000 for "Reactor Special and Independent Reviews, Investigations, and Enforcement" in fiscal year 1994, and not more than $31,369,000 in fiscal year 1995.
- Not more than $164,244,000 for "Nuclear Safety Management and Support" in fiscal year 1994. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission may allocate up to $31,000,000 for "Reactor Special and Independent Reviews, Investigations, and Enforcement" in fiscal year 1994, and up to $31,369,000 in fiscal year 1995. Additionally, up to $164,244,000 may be used for "Nuclear Safety Management and Support" in fiscal year 1994. The Commission is limited to using no more than 1 percent of the allocated amounts for its authority under section 31a of the Atomic Energy Act. $164,244,000 allocated for fiscal year 1994 and $164,062,000 for fiscal year 1995 for "Nuclear Safety Management and Support". The Nuclear Regulatory Commission limited to using 1% of allocated amounts for grants and cooperative agreements. Grants must comply with relevant laws. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission can enter into grants and agreements with organizations like universities and governments. Grants must comply with relevant laws and can be reallocated for different programs. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission can reallocate allocated amounts for different programs or activities within its jurisdiction, subject to limitations on appropriations. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission can reallocate funds for programs or activities within its jurisdiction, with a limitation of $500,000 increase or reduction without advance notification to specific committees. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission can reallocate funds within its jurisdiction by up to $500,000 without advance notification to specific committees. Funds from the Nuclear Waste Fund are restricted to specific uses. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission can reallocate funds within its jurisdiction by up to $500,000 without advance notification to specific committees. Funds from the Nuclear Waste Fund are restricted to high-level nuclear waste activities and cannot be used for other Commission activities. SEC. 4. RETENTION OF CERTAIN FUNDS. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission can retain and use funds received for various programs and services, subject to appropriations, for associated expenses without time restrictions. SEC. 5. TRANSFER OF CERTAIN FUNDS. SEC. 5. TRANSFER OF CERTAIN FUNDS. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission can transfer up to 5 percent of authorized amounts to its Office of Inspector General from appropriations, excluding funds from the Nuclear Waste Fund. SEC. 6. LIMITATION ON SPENDING AUTHORITY. Payments under this Act are limited to amounts specified in advance in appropriation Acts.
